dialogues.text: Hey...I just got my ass kicked, give me a break. Chase forcefully sticks his rifle into Luke's gut.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Your lucky I don't take you out right now! You killed a police officer and I'd have every right to gun your miserable self down. Had himself a family. Luke looks as if this may effect him...just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I tried to knock him out.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Stop here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke stops as Chase scans the area, bends down to check t tracks and the blood. His face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sotto) I knew it. I always knew it. (beat) But what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What did you say? Chase looks back to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You stumble on to this thing feeding or something? Threaten it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Threaten it? Let me tell you something, there is nothing that could make me threaten that thing. Chase nods, his face shows it all.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Tell me where your friends are headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE MOVE with Ken ACROSS the quiet living room until we se Erin and Harris seated on the couch, gun-less. He joins them. Travis is seated at the fireplace, the warm glow lighting room. Kayla watches the windows.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: So....Can one of you two fine gentleman tell me what the hell is out there? Everyone in the room is quiet. Maybe unsure...maybe too afraid to speculate.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some help you all are. Well, it's nothing that can't be cured with enough bullets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: We're going back out there?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: We're going to have to sometime. No pissed off bear is going to stand between me and my money.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Seems nothing stands between you all and your money. Some people have strange loyalties. Travis notes this key word.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Just what it is son. Life is all about loyalty. Question will always be, where do you place yours? Travis smiles at the older man.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You are a pretty smart ol' guy, aren't you? A lot going on upstairs in that head of yours.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Ain't no more in here than in yours partner. I've just been making the right choices. Travis is locked into this guy now, something between the

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Whose the one staring down the barrel of the gun?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Is that your criteria for the right choice? Travis stands, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: We are going to need you two to get us safe and sound to the Canadian border. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now it's Harris' turn to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You lookin for Canada, huh? well, I would say you were a hell of a lot closer to it this morning. But somewhere a long the way, you started walkin back to our fine little village.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What? A circle?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Well, take us about ninety minutes at a slight jog to be back in town. BUMP! Something upstairs! Everyone shifts their focus. Travis motions to his two partners. The group pulls back from the stairwell, their guns trained on it in grasped i their shaky fingers. Harris, Ken and Erin eyeball the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give us a gun.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shhh. Something moves down the stairs....approaching cautiously Everyone's eyes trained on it when...LUKE STEPS OUT!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey...thanks for leaving me back there.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Damn boy. As they lower there guns slightly....Chase appears, pushe Luke into the center of the room, his gun popping back an forth between the crooks.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Drop the guns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Put it down now!

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Drop ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: We just went through this partner and I'm not about to again. You want to get out of here alive, be smart. Luke looks to Erin, winks.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey. She shakes her head, but is probably still glad to see hi

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I'm the only chance you have of getting out of here alive.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: How you figure that farmer Fred? This realization is almost hard for Chase to say after al these years.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Because... I think I know.. what's out there.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What's your guess? Yeti?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The Yeti is actually the Abominable Snowman, it lives in the Himalayas. In Tibet it means "little man-like animal". (everyone looks at him, Luke shrugs) This guy is an encyclopedia on all that stuff. Travis turns back to Chase, all eyes now on him, maybe bu he does have the answers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: What you have out there right now is something very powerful, very smart and for some reason he seems to want you all dead.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Because he's been following you a good four miles and it looks to be a bit more than curiosity. Travis fidgets with this, finding for once they must be u against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: So you trying to tell me you can get us safely out of here? Chase laughs at the absurdity.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I just said I'm the only chance you got.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Travis, we can't shoot that son of a bitch if we don't have guns.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: And you can't shoot if you don't have arms. WHAM! A LOUD METALLIC BANG OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What's that noise?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: At this point it could be a great white shark... WHAM! This sounds more deliberate. And then...WHAM! The lights go out! The GENERATOR HUM quickly dying out. Ken moves to the window and peers out.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken presses his face close to the glass to see what's out there. A HUGE FORM MOVES BY FRAME! Ken falls back, startled.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What's going on out there? Glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Well, since there are no monsters out there I guess nothing could have taken out the generator.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What? It can't be that thing, can it? I mean, it doesn't have a brain. (turns to Chase) Does it?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Got a better idea? SLAM! Something heavy and hard hits the front porch. Everyone spins to the door. Wham! Again the noise. Wade grabs his face, looking like he's losing it. Wham! Luke jumps up and moves over to Travis, taking his sidear from his belt. Travis looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You want to check that out?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I'm just dying to. They move towards the door together....slowly. Wade and Kayla aim their guns as steady as they can. Luke grabs fo the handle and stops, whispers to Travis.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me ask you..... why are we even opening this door? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Travis just gives him that glare and Luke shrugs, turns t handle. The door creaks open, everyone tenses. The air outside is cold and still and very, very dark.... Luke peers outside, his gun ready. Nothing. All is quiet. He closes the door slowly...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Then it happens! Eli's body flies through the open door knocking Luke to the ground. Wade fires at them!

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Come on Kyle! Let's take him out!!!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Stop! Travis slams the door, backs up. Luke pulls out from unde the body and charges on Wade.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Wade you idiot! Wade sticks his gun on Luke.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I didn't know what it was! Kayla tries not to come unwound.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Who is that old man! Chase appears to be at a loss as everyone else. Erin looks to the corner of the room, her back pack sitti unguarded. She moves to it quickly, flips it open and pul out from a small zipper inside....A GUN! She charges up to Travis in the commotion and sticks the in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I start shooting in three... (cocks gun) Two.... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay! He drops his. Kayla stares at her a moment and then final drops hers. Luke snatches Wades from his hands as well. Erin looks at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You too lover boy. A moment of stunned silence and he tosses his gun. Harris and Ken go for the guns when Erin...

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold it. They stop, trying to get this figured out.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Well, looks like our damsel in distress has a dark side.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You okay there little darling? Erin is shaking. Rage, nerves...but shaking.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Oh I'm just fine. I'm real fine now. And why am I fine you ask? Trapped in a cabin with a bunch of bank thieves with guns and some angry rock throwing monster? She grabs hold of her quickly tensing fingers.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Easy darlin'.... Erin looks at Ken and Harris.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: That's easy. Because if you spend your life doing everything to please someone else, eating the way they want, living the way they want...even marrying the way they want. You can feel pretty...dead. She begins to flick the ring again on her finger, dangero close to the trigger. Luke moves slowly towards her (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I go from one man who my whole life would never show he cared to nearly marrying another who cared too much. And for once in my life I just do something for myself and just leave. And look where I find myself? (beat) And the funny thing is, that's what makes me feel fine. If things can go from that bad to this worse... then by all means they got to be able to get a whole fuckin lot better. Erin looks the group over closely, coming back to reality

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So...you want to know what I think? If even one of you wants to try and get out of here and start your damn life over again right...Then quit pointing these things at each other and start backing each other up! Erin tosses Luke the gun.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's your chance lover boy. Take this thing and use it right. For once. Luke slowly, almost apprehensively, takes the gun....He t to everyone, takes a breath. There is a tacit consensus in the room as every one reach for the guns and slowly pick them up. No one points them each other this time, they just go back to checking the windows and doors. Erin sits by the fire place, staring into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear door to the cabin opens slowly....Harris sticks head out, looks around, SMALL FLASHLIGHT in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Can't see nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Travis and Chase step into the door frame cautiously, loo outside as well.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: "Can't see nothing"? Does that comfort you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Son, at my age I'm comforted knowing I am still standing here talking to somebody.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: So, “at your age" can you still fix that generator? Harris shoots him a glance, offers out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Age before beauty. Travis smirks and moves out, Harris follows behind. Chase presses himself up against the door, rifle ready. Harris and Travis move over to the SMALL GENERATOR along of the wall. A CABLE has been broken off, the dents and scratches on the generator very apparent. They rotate the flashlight to the side where a LARGE ROCK sits.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: How did it know? Harris looks back to Chase who has the same worried look his face. The sheriff bends down for a closer look at the damage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Looks pretty clean. I think I can reattach it. He fumbles around with the cable as both Chase and Harris scan the area closely, nervously. Everything seems to mov The trees. The bushes. The night itself.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Hurry up pops, it's starting to feel funny out here. Harris finally reattaches the cable, reaches around to a switch and it hits it. WHOOMP! The generator hums to life  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla and Luke look around the room as the lights come ba on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Nice work. And as he light from the cabin slowly illuminates the tre behind Travis we see the blurry but distinct image of the giant watching them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase sees it first, his face in a momentary state of sho and awe. Then, he is back on reflex.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Move it!! He shoulders his rifle and fires, tearing up the bushes a roars in anger. Travis and Harris quickly stumble back to the door as the thing charges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men move in the door as quick as they can as th violently moving shape descends on them. They slam the do just in time...backing down the hall, their guns trained the door. Nothing. Quiet once again. The pounding and roaring never comes. The three drop to the ground, exhausted as the oth file in the shadows of the background, silently watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Wade stand near each other, looking out into the darkness. Occasionally, they steal glances at one another

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: So what are we going to do? Just mope around here like a bunch of sitting ducks?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Sitting ducks? That's like a thirties gangster term isn't it? Wade casually waves the gun towards Ken. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Be careful Mr. Mountie. When the shooting starts again you don't want to get caught in front of a stray bullet. Luke moves from the kitchen looks to Ken. Luke moves

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Hey what?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You scrap pretty good. (turns to Wade) Guy hits pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Well, not hard enough apparently.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Thanks. That's real nice. off, spots Erin by the fire. Ken looks to Wade and the two exchange a quick uncomforta glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin plays

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the videotape in her hands. An OLD TV near by. Luke stands over Erin, stands near her. Kayla rolls h eyes at him. He catches this, turns to Erin.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sounds like you've had a pretty crappy day. She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you made a move. You said screw what everyone else thinks, I'm doing this for me. That's good. She looks to him, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Oh this coming from the womanizing bank robber. Well, thanks for the moral booster, but somehow it lacks a bit of credibility. This stings Luke, but he hides it as well as he can.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What? Like I can't have morals?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You just can't see it can you? Go look in the mirror Luke. But look real hard, past the smile and green eyes. Look at the heart...if you can. Luke tries to find his posture-of-cool again while facing this onslaught of truth.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'm past all this okay. You don't want my friendly pick me up, that's fine. He moves away, drops into the couch, looks to Kayla smili

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Shot down.... Luke reaches for a PACK OF SOMETHING on the table. Pulls a food substance and starts to chew it, reacts and looks Chase in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What is this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Freeze dried jerky.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (takes another bite) I really want to get out of here. Ken looks at him, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, sometimes life sneaks up on you. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: vba) think JOKE GONG Rd grow up and be a rock star and find that life has just cornered you in some alley and the only way out is to fight. Ken shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Do you just not realize what you do hurts people? Chase grabs an ASH TRAY and throws it at Luke, who reflexively grabs it. He looks stunned at Chase.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: He knows when something is going to hurt, just like the rest of us. He knows what to do to stop it too. Just like the rest of you. (beat) Priscilla back at the cafe covered for your sorry butt boy. I know that girl. She did that cause you made her feel important, didn't you hot shot? Said something to make her feel like you were going come back and make her a princess. But you don't give a damn, do you? And you did it anyway. Luke looks to Erin, feeling naked.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You know what mountain man, I think that's enough of your mouth tonight. Luke gets to his feet, Ken takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't owe you an explanation! Chase motions to Ken it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: No...you don't owe anyone anything, do you? But at least right now...you ain't fooling no one either. Luke looks once more to Erin, his shield down.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase takes a seat at the kitchen table, trying to peak o into the night. Harris joins him at the table. There may some estrangement here.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your officer. He seemed like a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: He was. Harris fidgets a bit, but remaining focused.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just....well, I want to say, considering these circumstances..... All these years...people In town not understanding... Not...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You don't have to apologize for no one sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Well, okay. I'll apologize for myself then. I always figured whatever it was out there that night you lost Sara...it wasn't...I also know I had a lot to say about you not being a part of my department. It's just...just I Chase stands. It's uncomfortable, but he can also understand.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: No hard feelings Harris. What are you going to do. I have to pull over some guy speeding through town, he looks up at me and says with a snicker: "Hey officer, ain't you the guy that filmed Bigfoot? I seen you on TV." (beat, has heard it before) You can't have someone wearing that badge that made a name for himself talking about a big ape. (beat) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The crazy FERRE GANT IBbt his wife and had a breakdown... Harris looks to him, places a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I hate to say it but I wish I could say you were crazy at this point. (beat, looks outside) But your not. Then, to both of their surprise, the VOICE OF SARA laughi begins to drift from out of the living room...

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Grumpy husband...that's what you are. Grumpy, stubborn, wants to do things his way, full of pride. Chase moves from the table as if in a dream, towards the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chase rounds the corner, he notes the TV on, the haunt image of himself and his wife on the screen and the group the living room watching closely, riveted. The tape in th VCR.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: But you know what...you also believe in the best in life like no one I have ever known. No matter how bad times get, no matter how hard you want to resist..you always find a way to come shining through. Chase stops, her words returning to him once again for th first time in who knows how many years. And then the large image crosses the screen and pulls everyone at_a_new attention. Chase grabs a REMOTE on the table and hits the pause. The creature's misshapen form frozen on the screen. He places the remote back down, looks to the others.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What is this thing? You're old friends with it. Chase looks to the window, shaking his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Bigfoot. Sasquatch. The Mountain Devil. Got itself a lot of names. But kid, outside of that, everything I thought I knew...was wrong. The captive audience doesn't move an inch.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know about the rest of you killjoys, but I got a bladder that's been yelling at me for an hour now. (to Erin) Come on GI Jane, let's go powder ourselves. Erin stands, a bit unsure but follows her down the hall. Luke stands, moves to the window.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I thought these Sasquatch guys ate berries and crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin leans against the bathroom door. Kayla is pulling up pants, the scars running up and down her beautiful legs. Kayla notes Erin is staring.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Admiring my beautiful legs? See, I don't keep photos of my ex boyfriend all folded up in my purse. These are all the reminders I get. She buttons them up and moves to the sink to wash her han looking at Erin's reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. We all got our scars. Some of us just wear them on the inside. Cover them up better with a nice car, an interesting life or a pair of big tits. Kayla moves close to Erin, looks at her a beat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some of us can't hide them. Some of us have to carry them around for the whole world to see. Kayla moves out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla and Erin move down the narrow hallway. As they pass door....

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: Something on the other side. The two women stop, looking towards it. Erin readies her gun. Nothing more. Kayla looks to Erin and reaches for the handle.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Easy. She turns it slowly and the door creaks open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two look into the room, it's darkness hardly inviting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others in the living room align themselves to see dow the hall. Chase moves closer. Wade stands near the front door.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Don't know old timer...probably nothing. As Chase moves closer, those in the living room stand sta still. Wade stands by the front door, smells the air.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: There's that stink ag.... BOOM! The front door explodes forward and Hell follows wi at! The beast bursts into the living room, ramming Wade again the far wall. Everyone jumps, completely caught off guard This thing is more vicious than any of us have even imagi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wade begins screaming in the creatures arms as it pounds against the lights. Chase, Harris, and Ken all try and get a sight on it, but man in his arms makes it near impossible.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shoot it!

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Help! !!!

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Wait'll he drops him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Erin bolts for the living room, Kayla takes her chance flies through the room and out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris tries to get a shot and then...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Damn it to hell... He shoots the creature in the leg. It roars and spins Wad smack into Travis who flies across the room. It's eyes on fire it moves towards Travis. Harris sees this and rushes to Travis, grabbing him, drag him out the front door

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone out now! Luke spots the cash on the counter and moves for it. Erin pops in the room seeing him grab it. He turns to her, a beat, then.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Come on. She runs towards Luke as the rest of them move outside quickly, the beast swatting at them and then returning to kicking and screaming wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is outside, turning back to the nightmare insid the house. Ken looks to Harris. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: We can't let him... Harris is already moving back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Stay there. As Harris moves to the door, gun raised, the SOUND OF SCREAMING AND DESTRUCTION suddenly halt. The silence is deafening. All look towards the dark house staring back a them. Ken reaches over and grabs the cash bag from Luke's hand. Footsteps in the trees! They all swing to look and see Ka moving as fast as she can through the dark. WHAM! The creature charges the front door! All the guns open fire! Tearing the front of the cabin up the beast roars back inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Hold it. Hold it. The gun fire stops, the SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS TEARING THROUG THE HOUSE. A GLASS BREAKS. Instinctively all look around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Dude, I think he's back outside. Snap! A noise in the cabin again, guns trained to the doo instantly. And then...Wade stumbles out! A bloody mess. H collapses to the porch, dead as they get AWHO00000000000000000! A howl that chills everyone's bloo off in the distance. But not far enough. Harris turns to Travis, tosses him a gun.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Let's go. The group starts at a run, the same direction Kayla vanis in.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anxious group plows through the darkness, the moonlig their only guide. Their hearts carrying their legs faster and further than they're used to. Harris' breathes deeply, his gasps painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla moves quickly through the trees, not sure where she going and not caring. Instincts on auto drive. As she pounds through the mud and earth, the sound of crashing t grabs her attention. She stops, waiting, listening. THE SOUND AGAIN. Her breathing speeds up, the sound too close. Kayla turns to a tree and frantically begins to climb. He arms grasping for any branch. We grit our own teeth watch her climb. Then beneath her, Sasquatch appears!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group stops, KAYLA'S SCREAMING off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Which way? They all look around, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla struggles up the tree. The Sasquatch begins to ram it's massive body against the tree! Kayla aims her gun un steadily at the monster and fires off several shots to no avail. And then the gun finally clicks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stand by, listening hopelessly, Luke raises his s gun and fires off a blast in the air. The others turn to him, getting the idea and also fire shots off into the ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sasquatch turns for a moment, the shots grabbing his attention. Kayla makes some distance...but not enough. Sh has hit the top of the tree! She turns back to see the Sasquatch now once again focused on her. Kayla's face grow's defiant as she spits at the beast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You don't get the pleasure you ass! And Kayla dives from the tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group are now suddenly aware of the quiet. The scream and growls no more. Harris, his face in immediate pain, clutches his chest as collapses to the ground. Ken turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Sheriff! The younger cop moves to him, grabbing him.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sheriff. Take a breath. Come on. Travis watches closely, shakes his head. Something about this sight, he knows.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Breathing ain't going to help him. Ken snaps.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Shut up you ass! What do you care! And then, in an agonizing moment, Harris goes limp, his breath passing his lips in a final wheeze. Ken places his head to the older man's chest. He then begins to press ha on his chest, over and over. The others watch, feeling the helplessness. Travis takes a deep breath and tosses his gun to Chase, moving towards Harris. As he approaches Ken, the young co grows defensive, like a lioness over her dead cub.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back off!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Cool your heels Gomer. Let me in. (beat, firmer) Come on! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ken pulls back, sensing that it may be the best thing as Travis moves over the fallen sheriff. Travis cracks his fingers. What takes place over the following dialogue is difficult and desperate CPR tactics for a heart attack. I hard to tell if the tension in his voice is from his acti or his memory.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was thirteen years old and my old man could drink an Irish Man blind. Drag me to more beer buddy drinkin contests than I can remember. But one night, he pushed his limit. I new that bastard had let his ego get the best of him. We were walkin down the docks, Chesapeake Bay, I saw him take this big gulp of air, thinkin maybe he was trying to get some fresh sea salt in his lungs. Then he fell flat on his face. I turned his big bloated belly over and began beating on his chest like a drum...over and over...screamin and cryin. Trying to get that rusted heart of his going. I said "come on you old heart. Beat you son of a bitch!" Then, Harris' eyes open! His breath snapping back into hi lungs as he sits up. Travis falls back, exhausted from th effort as Ken moves to Harris.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Harris! Thank God... All eyes turn back to Travis who slowly rises as if he ne once broke from his story, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: ..But, that old boy's heart never did start beating again. (beat) Dumb bastard. Travis moves over to get his gun back from Chase, who han it back gladly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group comes to an opening in the trees, a stretch of field ahead of them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: This clearing up ahead, it's another half mile and we're at the edge of town. They continue to look behind them, nervously. Erin looks back to see Luke writing something on AN ENVEL and sticking it into his pocket. She frowns, knowing ther is cash inside of it from the bag. She moves over to him.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Still have your mind on "priorities" huh?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Erin realizes as she speaks...

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You know, it's really not hard to change if you want to. It's only hard when you really don't give a damn. She moves off, leaving Luke alone once again. Ken is walking with Harris, sticking close. He turns to l behind him, seeing the dark length of forest they have managed to clear. But he seems to be looking further than that. Harris moves ahead, up to Travis. The two men look to eac other, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat, smiles) Just don't tell any of my friends. That's when it happens: SASQUATCH vaults from the trees a blasts into Travis, his gun flying from his hand. Chase i knocked to the ground. Luke and Ken charge up firing their weapons into the monster's back. It flinches, but is so far gone in it's primal rage, they don't slow him down at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Click. Click. Their guns empty. The beast turns a menacing face to them that would freeze the most hardened man. It raises it's a in what can only be taken as some sort of primitive warni Travis groans at it's feet, crawls towards the nearby tre where his gun lies. He grabs it, just as the thing turns him. And then....We hear the CELL PHONE RING! Both Travis and Sasquatch react.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Charlie? The Sasquatch moves to Travis, whose face now registers t inevitable, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah what the hell Charlie. Sell it all.... Then the giant grabs Travis and slings him into a tree! Ken's gun empty, grabs for his knife, and in a sudden impulsive moment, charges the beast, jumping on it's back

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey! The thing thrashes around trying to throw the human paras off of him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Ken! Luke goes for a log and then...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Forget it! You two cut back through the trees. Keep running and don't stop. Luke pauses a moment as Chase pulls Harris with him throu the trees, back into the forest. He fires off a shot at t beast as it begins to pummel both Ken and Travis. The bea turns to Chase as Luke and Erin slip away in another direction. IT TURNS TO THEM, FANGS GLISTENING. Boom! Chase fires another shot and Sasquatch turns back t the older men, moving towards them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke and Erin slip further into the bush at a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin and Luke tear through the woods, their hearts racing fast as their feet. They approach a dark clearing, the tr opening up. Bam! Bam! The sound of gun fire stops them. They both listen, the l voices and growls in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hah! Come on!! Bam! Then it's quiet. CRICKETS. The wind. WHOOMP! A TRUCK DRIVES by them! It's huge carcass of meta passing by at seventy miles per hour. The two jump. They look to the ground and see the cement. They are on a road! They turn to the truck, yelling. But continues down the road, the light slowly dissolving into dark and then it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Damn it. And then the two look to each other, realizing the CRICKE are no longer chirping. They turn to the woods, the LOW BREATHING suddenly audible. The hot steam becoming clear the trees. They step back slowly, watching. Luke turns to look at Erin, catches the look on her face. see the change in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (whispers) It would have been nice. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Just start running and don't stop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She looks at him, maybe sees the change in his face. Luke grabs A STICK on the ground, snaps back to her.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Just go! She does, her feet carrying her down the road. Luke turns the dark form taking shape in the trees and charges.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on big boy. He charges into the darkness. Erin turns and sees as the arms reach out from the blackness and carry Luke up into air! She stops.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Luke! Slam! Like a car hitting you at 50 mph hour, the SOUND of Luke's breath leaves his body in an explosion. The SOUND FLESH HITTING BARK, over and over. It is hard to tell whe the crunching noise is coming from. Erin is unable to leave him behind.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop! I'm here!! Luke's limp body sails out of the trees onto the cement. Erin begins to move to him when....the giant steps forwar onto the road! He moves over to Luke, reaches down and touches him. Luke groans but offers no resistance. Then, the Sasquatch turns to Erin and begins moving slowl towards her.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Erin! She turns, surprised to see Chase and Harris limp their w from the trees. Chase's gun now trained on the simian. Th move to her as it closes in on them agonizingly slow. Chase's rifle remains focused on him.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, come on then! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But then, something begins to happen...the creature begin slow, moving at an exhausted walk. His head begins to dro his once vicious snarl slowly replaced by a softening fac That_is when we notice the trail of blood he is leaving behind. His wounds from the battle leaving their mark on cold cement. As the three step back, the giant then turns slowly towar the tree-line and drops to his knees, still trying to mov forward. He no longer seems to want to get them, he just wants to move...somewhere. It crumples to the ground, a sigh of breath escaping from it's collapsing lungs. It's long arm reaching for the tre as if to touch them one more time. The three watch as the giant loses it's battle to life. E moves over to Luke, cradling him. And then with one final groan....the Sasquatch dies. The two men move towards it cautiously. Luke looks up to Erin, blood coming from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That....that...was intense.... She nods, stroking his hair lightly. Then...another NOISE catches all their attention...in the forest. Chase raises his rifle as the trees part...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SASQUATCH
dialogues.text: Harris, Chase and Erin freeze. This one a female, lighter in color. The face of the new comer turns to them, it’s expression a calm that we have yet seen on one of these animals. After a beat, she pulls her gaze from the smaller invader and moves over to the fallen one. She smells him, twice, then lets out a noise that could only be a sigh of pain. She knows her mate is dead. She then grabs the fallen body and slowly begins to drag mate back to their green world. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: At the trees, it stops one final moment, the dead creatur cradled in it's arms and turns to Chase. Chase returns th look to this new one, and we now feel that we may have be somewhere like this once before, a long time ago. And that's when we notice the BABY SASQUATCH on her shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's small newborn arms wrapped around her neck, grasping fur tightly. It's matted hair, still wet from it's recent birth. Chase lowers his rifle, Harris lowers his head and Erin h back what may be a tear as they all come to realize who h been the real invaders here. With one final breath, mother and child step back with th fallen father and disappear into the darkness of the timb Luke's eyes return to Erin.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Reach...reach in my...pocket. She reaches in, careful as he flinches from the pain. She pulls out the large bill fold of cash in the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I made a lot of promises...For once, I wanted one to be more than just a promise. Erin nods, knowing what he means.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I guess even a guy like you has something good going on in that heart of yours. He smiles, faintly.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Even a broken watch....is right twice a day.... She smiles, then turns, sees Chase and Harris watching th Harris sighs, looking up as if he didn't see a thing. Erin looks back to Luke who is now obviously...gone. Harris reaches for his walky, places it to his mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Stanley? You there? Over. A beat...and then a very excited Stanley pops on the walk

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy Moley Sheriff! Is that you??

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh..sorry for the language but it's good to hear from you sir. Where are you? Over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Not sure son, but it's a heck of a lot better than where I was before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's truck and Chase's tow truck sit off the side of road. Harris, Erin and Stanley carefully place Luke's coa covered body into the back. Off to the side, Chase with his arm wrapped over Raquel's shoulder, stares out into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (re: Luke) That one of the bad guys? Harris looks to the body and then turns back to his deput hands him the bag of money.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: No. That's one of the good guys. Raquel looks to her father.

dialogues.speaker: RAQUEL
dialogues.text: What happened out there? Chase takes a beat, thinks. He hugs her tighter

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I got a lot of making up to do with you. He pulls her across the street as they move towards the others. Stanley turns (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: What...well, what happened? Was..was it a bear or something. Harris looks to Chase who watches amused, for once on the other side of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah...a bear or something.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Damn. The younger cop moves off as Harris shoots a final look t Chase.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Join the club Sheriff. Chase and his daughter move off towards their truck. Harris turns back to see Erin who stands at the far end o the street. Erin looks down to see the envelope in her hand. A smile touches her lips as she reaches down and pulls the ring f her finger.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Someday. Someday when I want to. And then she hauls the ring off into the distant sky. Wit sigh she looks to the beautiful horizon ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun bathes the mountain side with fresh new warmth. In front of the diner from the opening scene is Priscilla sweeping the porch, the routine she has done most of her life. A RENTAL CAR pulls up into the lot, stopping shy of the front. WE FOLLOW THE FEMALE LEGS as they move towards the hard working waitress. Priscilla turns to see Erin approa

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Hi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Are you Priscilla?

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: That's me. Erin reaches into her purse and pulls out the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I have something for you.

dialogues.speaker: PRISCILLA
dialogues.text: For me? What is it? Erin hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: A whole lot of hope. (beat) Don't ever let it go. Erin moves back to the car as Priscilla looks to the enve and reads the note from Luke on it:

dialogues.speaker: ENJOY THE RIDE TO YOUR FUTURE
dialogues.text: She opens the envelope and sees the huge wad of cash. Her jaw drops as she sits on the porch, stunned. She looks up to see Erin's rental car pulling away down t dirt road. The dust swallows the car in a cloud and we he a strange sound that may be THE DISTANT SCREECH of tires....or maybe something else.

dialogues.speaker: THE END
dialogues.text: (MORE)
